intro: Dorstenia nyangensis, commonly known as the African mountain fig, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that are often described as resembling fingers. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
